a-frame vr scene, museum of modern art
Make sure everything is in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

Certainly! Below is a simple A-Frame VR scene that represents a Museum of Modern Art. This example includes embedded CSS and JavaScript within a single HTML file. You can copy and paste this code into an HTML file and open it in a web browser that supports WebVR. ```html Museum of Modern Art VR
Use WASD to move, Mouse to look around
``` ### Instructions: 1. Copy the code above. 2. Paste it into a text editor and save it as `museum.html`. 3. Open the `museum.html` file in a web browser that supports A-Frame (like Chrome or Firefox). 4. Use the WASD keys to move around and the mouse to look around the scene. This simple VR scene includes a sky, some geometric shapes representing art pieces, and a camera with a cursor for interaction. You can expand upon this by adding more features, textures, or interactivity as needed!
